content.par: This document details a pre-ride check list to ensure bicycle safety and proper functionality. Following these steps before each ride will minimize the risk of mechanical failure and enhance rider safety.
content.heading: 1. Tools & Equipment Required

list.item: (Optional) Torque wrench (for fasteners - refer to component specifications)

content.heading: 2. Pre-Ride Check Procedure
content.par: This procedure is organized into numbered steps. Each step includes indication conditions (normal and abnormal) and associated actions if abnormalities are detected.
content.heading: 3. Step-by-Step Checks
3.1. Step 1: General Condition

item.action: Check the overall condition of the bike before every ride.
item.abnormal: Any visible damage or unusual wear.

content.heading: 3.2. Step 2: Fastener Check

item.action: Check all fasteners (bolts, nuts, quick releases) for tightness.
item.normal: All fasteners are secure and tight.
item.warning: Incorrect tightening force can result in component failure, leading to loss of control.
item.remedy: Tighten and torque fastener according to specific maintenance instruction for the related component.

content.heading: 3.3. Step 3: Bounce Test

item.action: Lift the front wheel off the ground 2-3 inches and bounce it on the ground.
item.abnormal: Bike rattles or parts appear loose.
item.remedy: Secure the loose part according to the specific maintenance instruction for the related part.

content.heading: 3.4. Step 4: Tire Pressure Check

item.normal: Tire pressure is correct according to the specification printed on the tire sidewall.
item.abnormal: Tire pressure is outside the specified range.
item.high_pressure: Bleed air from the tire until it reaches the maximum pressure printed on the sidewall.
item.low_pressure: Add air to the tire, not exceeding the maximum pressure printed on the sidewall.

content.heading: 3.5. Step 5: Tire Inspection

item.action: Inspect the tire for cuts or cracks.
item.normal: Tire has no cuts or cracks.
item.warning: Riding on a damaged tire could cause tire failure, leading to loss of control.

content.heading: 3.6. Step 6: Wheel Trueness Check

item.action: Spin each wheel and observe for wobble.
item.caution: Wheels must be true for rim brakes to work effectively.
item.remedy: Have the bike serviced to true the wheels.

content.heading: 3.7. Step 7: Rim Inspection

item.normal: No wear indicator marks are visible on the rim.
item.abnormal: Wear indicator marks are visible on the rim.
item.warning: Riding on a rim at the end of its life can result in wheel failure and loss of control.

content.heading: 3.8. Step 8: Brake Check

item.normal: Front and rear brakes securely grip the wheel rim. Brake lever movement is within 1 inch.

abnormal.remedy: Tighten brakes according to maintenance procedure. Check/replace brake cables if necessary.
Tighten brakes according to maintenance procedure.
